member.name: M:MS.Gamification.Startup.CreateSchedulerCompositionRoot
member.summary: Creates a DI container for the scheduler service. Tasks execute outside of any web request, so we can't use any services that rely on a HttpContext. Similarly, we cannot use InRequestScope() so we must use InTransientScope() or InsingletonScope() instead.

member.name: M:MS.Gamification.Areas.Admin.Controllers.UserAdministrationController.CreateUserFromEmailString(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to recognize various user name and email formats and, if successful, creates a new from the parsed results.
member.param:
The input user name and email in one of the recognised formats:
Format Description
Simple RFC822 email address
A simple email address in RFC-822 format.
Example: Joe@user.com
Since there is no user name component in this format, the parsed value is used as both the email address and the user name.
Canonical user name format
A user name and email address specified in canonical format.
Example: Joe User<Joe@user.com>
Comma Separated Values (CSV) format
A user name and email address separated with a comma.
Example: Joe User, Joe@user.com
member.exception: Not in any of the recognized formats.

member.name: M:MS.Gamification.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.summary: Indicates that a work item is in a queue awaiting its scheduled run time.

member.summary: Indicates that the item is being dispatched to a work item procesor.

member.summary: Indicates that the work item was dispatched successfully

member.summary: Indicates that the work item could not be dispatched

member.summary: Indicates that an unrecoverable error occurred when the work item was dispatched.

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.QuerySpecifications.ChallengesInMissionLevel
member.summary: Returns all of the challenges associated with a mission Level.

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.QuerySpecifications.LevelHasAssociatedObservations
member.summary: A query specification that can be used to determine whether a given Mission Level has any observations associated with it. The query returns a set of integers, which will be empty if no observations were found, or will contain a single element representing the number of observations associated with the level. This is designed to be convenient for use with Repository.GetMaybe.

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.QuerySpecifications.ObservationsForUserMission

member.name: M:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.GameRulesService.ComputePercentComplete(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{MS.Gamification.Models.Challenge},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{MS.Gamification.Models.Observation})
member.summary: Computes the percent complete for a set of challenges, given a set of eligible observations. The computation is based on the number of points gained, rather than just a simple count.
member.param: The set of challenges that represents 100% progress.
The eligible observations for the set of challenges.
member.returns: The computed percentage, as an integer, guaranteed to be between 0% and 100% inclusive.
member.remarks: It is assumed that the set of observations has already been filtered for eligibility, e.g. by calling .

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.IFetchStrategy`1
member.summary: Defines an abstraction that enables a query to specify eager loading of related entities. Entity Framework normally uses lazy loading by default and this can lead to inefficient queries, notably the "N+1" problem (see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/97197/what-is-the-n1-selects-issue).

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.IQuerySpecification`2
member.summary: Represents a query that filters a set of input entities and projects the results onto a set of output entities.
member.typeparam: The type of the input entities to be filtered.
The type of the projected output entities.

member.name: P:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.IQuerySpecification`2.FetchStrategy
member.summary: Gets the fetch strategy, which specifies which entities are to be retrieved from storage. Many ORMs use "lazy loading" which can lead to the "N+1 Query Problem" if related entities are enumerated. The fetch strategy is a hint to whatever ORM is used as to which related entities should be loaded eagerly. The ORM or storage engine is free to ignore the hint.

member.name: M:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.IQuerySpecification`2.GetQuery(System.Linq.IQueryable{`0})
member.summary: Gets the LINQ expression tree ( representing the filter.
member.returns: IQueryable{TOut}, a LINQ query expression with deferred execution.

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.QuerySpecification`1
member.summary: Represents a projecting query specification, which filters a set of input entities and projects them onto a set of output entities. The types of the input and output entities may be the same or different.
member.typeparam: The type of the input entities to be filtered and of the output entities.

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.QuerySpecification`2
member.summary: Represents a projecting query specification, which filters a set of input entities and projects them onto a set of output entities. The types of the input and output entities may be the same or different.
member.typeparam: The type of the input entities to be filtered.
The projected type of the output entities.

member.name: M:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.QuerySpecification`2.GetQuery(System.Linq.IQueryable{`0})
member.summary: Gets the LINQ expression tree ( representing the filter.
member.returns: IQueryable{TOut}, a LINQ query expression with deferred execution.

member.name: P:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.QuerySpecification`2.FetchStrategy
member.summary: Gets the fetch strategy, which specifies which entities are to be retrieved from storage. Many ORMs use "lazy loading" which can lead to the "N+1 Query Problem" if related entities are enumerated. The fetch strategy is a hint to whatever ORM is used as to which related entities should be loaded eagerly. The ORM or storage engine is free to ignore the hint.

member.summary: Returns the specified number of characters from the head of a string.
member.param: The number of characters to be returned, must not be greater than the length of the string.
member.returns: The specified number of characters from the head of the source string, as a new string.
member.exception: Thrown if the requested number of characters exceeds the string length.

member.returns: The specified number of characters from the tail of the source string, as a new string.
member.exception: Thrown if the requested number of characters exceeds the string length.

member.summary: Keeps only the wanted (that is, removes all unwanted characters) from the string.
member.param: A list of the wanted characters. All other characters will be removed.
member.returns: A new string with all of the unwanted characters deleted. Returns if all the characters were deleted or if the source string was null or empty.

member.name: M:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.StringExtensions.Keep(System.String,System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Keeps only the wanted (that is, replaces all unwanted characters) from the string.
member.param: A list of the wanted characters. All other characters will be replaced with .
The character that will replace all unwanted characters.
member.returns: A new string with all of the unwanted characters deleted. Returns if all the characters were deleted or if the source string was null or empty.

member.name: M:MS.Gamification.BusinessLogic.Gamification.StringExtensions.Clean(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Removes all unwanted characters from a string.
member.param: A list of the unwanted characters. All other characters will be preserved.
member.returns: A new string with all of the unwanted characters deleted. Returns if all of the characters were deleted or if the source string was null or empty.

member.returns: A new string containing the old string with characters removed from the tail.

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.DataAccess.EntityFramework6.Repository`2
member.summary: Generic repository base class with common accessors.
member.typeparam: The type of entity contained by the repository.
The type of the primary key

remarks.para: This abstract base class implements the generic interface and provides implementations for common operations that should be available for all entity sets.

The implementation is coupled to the database technology being used, so if the persistence framework is changed or upgraded then this class will have to be updated or replaced with a new implementation. This will likely also affect all derived classes, which will also have to be updated or replaced.

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.DataAccess.Maybe`1
member.summary: Represents an object that may or may not have a value (strictly, a collection of zero or one elements). Use LINQ expression maybe.Any() to determine if there is a value. Use LINQ expression maybe.Single() to retrieve the value.
member.typeparam: The type of the item in the collection.
member.remarks: This type almost completely eliminates any need to return null or deal with possibly null references, which makes code cleaner and more clearly expresses the intent of 'no value' versus 'error'. The value of a Maybe cannot be null, because null really means 'no value' and that is better expressed by using .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with no value.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with a value.

member.summary: Gets an instance that does not contain a value.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is empty (has no value).

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper
member.summary: Globally Recognised Avatar - http://gravatar.com
member.remarks:
This implementation by Andrew Freemantle - http://www.fatlemon.co.uk/
Source, Wiki and Issues: https://github.com/AndrewFreemantle/Gravatar-HtmlHelper

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.DefaultImage
member.summary: In addition to allowing you to use your own image, Gravatar has a number of built in options which you can also use as defaults. Most of these work by taking the requested email hash and using it to generate a themed image that is unique to that email address

member.name: F:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.DefaultImage.Default
member.summary: Default Gravatar logo

member.name: F:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.DefaultImage.Http404
member.summary: 404 - do not load any image if none is associated with the email hash, instead return an HTTP 404 (File Not Found) response

member.name: F:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.DefaultImage.MysteryMan
member.summary: Mystery-Man - a simple, cartoon-style silhouetted outline of a person (does not vary by email hash)

member.name: F:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.DefaultImage.Identicon
member.summary: Identicon - a geometric pattern based on an email hash

member.name: F:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.DefaultImage.MonsterId
member.summary: MonsterId - a generated 'monster' with different colors, faces, etc

member.name: F:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.DefaultImage.Wavatar
member.summary: Wavatar - generated faces with differing features and backgrounds

member.name: F:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.DefaultImage.Retro
member.summary: Retro - awesome generated, 8-bit arcade-style pixelated faces

member.name: T:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.Rating
member.summary: Gravatar allows users to self-rate their images so that they can indicate if an image is appropriate for a certain audience. By default, only 'G' rated images are displayed unless you indicate that you would like to see higher ratings

member.name: F:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.Rating.G
member.summary: Suitable for display on all websites with any audience type

member.name: F:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.Rating.PG
member.summary: May contain rude gestures, provocatively dressed individuals, the lesser swear words, or mild violence

member.name: F:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.Rating.R
member.summary: May contain such things as harsh profanity, intense violence, nudity, or hard drug use

member.name: F:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.Rating.X
member.summary: May contain hardcore sexual imagery or extremely disturbing violence

member.name: M:MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.GravatarImage(System.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelper,System.String,System.Int32,MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.DefaultImage,System.String,System.Boolean,MS.Gamification.HtmlHelpers.GravatarHtmlHelper.Rating,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a Globally Recognised Avatar as an - http://gravatar.com
member.param: Default image if user hasn't created a Gravatar
URL to a custom default image (e.g: 'Url.Content("~/images/no-grvatar.png")' )
Prefer the default image over the users own Gravatar
Gravatar content rating (note that Gravatars are self-rated)

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a resource identifier that can be used to load an XML Schema Document (XSD).
